intro: Wormskioldia biviniana, commonly known as the African snowflake, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Wormskioldia biviniana is well adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its water-storing tissues.
